alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Orange and central Osceola Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Celebration to near West Lake Toho to 6 miles southwest of Lake Kissimmee to 7 miles east of Avon Park. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Saint Cloud, Bay Lake and Celebration. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
